resources.string: This app can be used by international carriers. The app helps to check if a traveller is allowed to travel to the destination country according to the local COVID restrictions. The app uses the Digital COVID Certificate for this purpose.
Travellers show their QR code on their mobile phones or on paper. Point your camera at the code in order to scan the DCC.
The app shows either a valid sign (green screen) or invalid sign (red screen). In case of a red screen the traveller needs an alternative proof of a negative COVID test, vaccination or recovery.
With this app, you can receive visitors again. But only if your location or activity falls under the designated locations.
The Terms of use provide information about how the app works, as well as your rights.
Use of the information shown in the app can only be used to perform the mandatory health checks for the journey it concerns.
No personal data is stored either centrally or in the app.
No personal data is stored either centrally or in the app.
By checking the box I confirm that I have read the Terms of use and agree with the contents.
Sorry, there was a technical error
This is an international QR code
This is not a valid certificate in the Netherlands. Ask the visitor to show a Dutch QR code.
Read here what you can do.

This does not mean the visitor has coronavirus. Possible causes
  • The visitor shows an international QR code
  • The QR code has been forwarded
  • The QR code has been forged
  • The time on the visitor\'s phone is incorrect
What to do now?Ask the visitor to get vaccinated or to take a test. After that, the visitor can use the CoronaCheck app to turn it into a QR code.

Make sure the QR code belongs to the visitor by checking if the details on your screen correspond with their proof of identity.Note: details may be incomplete
In order to protect the visitor’s privacy, not all data is displayed. Some fields may contain a hyphen (-). It’s sufficient to check the details that are displayed.If the details are incorrect, the visitor is not allowed access.

The “DCC cross border Scanner NL” app is developed by the Ministry of Infrastructure and Water affairs in The Netherlands to simplify travelling through EU countries. Health information of travellers can be checked against travelling policies by international carriers quickly and efficiently. Safe travelling will be quicker and easier that way.
Point the camera of your device at the QR code that is presented and wait for the app to process the code.
Scanner wants to access your camera
So the app can scan QR codes
The app is no longer in use. For more information, go to CoronaCheck.nl
To continue, install the latest version of the app.
You\'re not connected to the internet
You need to be connected to start the app.

Here\'s what changed
  • Description of acceptable use policy
  • App usage explanation
  • Camera usage permission
Read the full acceptable use policy here.
You can\'t proceed if you don\'t agree
You don\'t have access to the CoronaCheck Scanner app if you don\'t agree to the updated policy.

Ask the traveller to present a Digital COVID Certificate QR code on a mobile device or on paper. Keep your distance while pointing your camera in the app at the QR code and wait for the app to process the QR code. The app will proceed with checking the code automatically.
A green screen indicates that the QR code is valid. Check if the personal information presented in your screen is similar to the information on the ID presented by the traveller.
Person is holding a phone with a green screen and a black check mark.

If necessary check if the data in the test, vaccination or recovery information that is shown by your app indicates that traveling to the destination country by this traveler is allowed. If so access can be granted to the traveller.
Person is holding a phone with a red screen and a black cross.

A red screen indicates that the QR code is invalid. This does not mean that the traveller is infected with COVID!

Data in the QR code will not be shown by the app. The traveller needs to present other proof of negative testing, vaccination or recovery in order to be able to perform the mandatory control.
5. Red screen: causes and options to fix

A red screen can have multiple causes:

a. The certificate does not have a valid signature by a designated organization.

b. The trustlist of reference certificates for the signatures is expired, and cannot be updated at the moment. Choose ‘update trustlists’ in the menu and try again to scan the QR code.

c. Something is wrong with the scanner app. Close it entirely and restart to try scanning the QR code again.

d. Something is wrong with the app of the traveler. Ask the traveler to restart the app and try again.
6. Message: Trust list was not updated

Certain conditions result in a message in a red bar on top of your screen: “Trust list was not updated”. This message indicates that something went wrong while fetching the list of trusted issuers of the electronic signatures, possibly due to connection issues. This leads to certain valid QR codes will show as invalid in the app. Using the “Update lists” button you can manually retry the fetching operation. First make sure you are connected to the Internet.
You can continue to use the app. However, connect to the internet and try again using the “Update lists” button.
Select the colour code of the country
Which countries have which colour code?
DCC is valid however travelling to The Netherlands from a country with orange color code requires a valid negative test result. Ask for a DCC that contains a valid test result.n
DCC is valid however travelling to The Netherlands from a country with orange color code requires a valid negative test result. Ask for a DCC that contains a valid test result.
DCC contains a test result of a test that was taken %d hours ago, which is beyond the valid time frame. Check and ask for a more recent test result if necessary.
Travelling from red areas is forbidden.
A complete vaccination is required when travelling from orange countries
A valid recovery is required when travelling from orange countries

DCC is valid, but for travelling by aircraft or boat two negative test results are required. Ask for the second test result. This test must be less than %d hours old. At arrival a quarantine period is mandatory.
The test result is not recognized, ask for different proof of testing.
The testing type is not recognized. Check the validity of the test, or request a different proof of testing.
The QR code might not be a COVID related certificate. Check if the disease displayed is COVID or Corona related.
The manufacturer of the vaccine is not recognized. Check the manufacturer, or ask for a different certificate.
The vaccine type is not recognized. Check the vaccine type, or ask for a different certificate.
The vaccine is not properly recognized. Check the vaccine, or ask for a different certificate.
The date of birth appears to be incorrect. Check the date of birth with the ID of the traveller.
The country code is not recognized. Check the country code.
The date of birth appears to be incorrect. Check the date of birth with the ID of the traveller.
The vaccine date is not correct. Check if the vaccine is still valid.
This vaccination certificate is not yet valid. Vaccine certificates become valid 14 days after the last vaccination date.
The test date is incorrect. Check if the test is still valid.
The test date for this recovery certificate is not valid. Check if the date is between 11 and 180 days old.
The date from which this recovery certificate is valid is incorrect. Check the recovery start date.
The date until which this recover certificate is valid is incorrect. Check if the certificate is still valid today.

The DCC cross border Scanner NL requires consent to use the scanner’s phone camera. This consent is required to scan the DCC, in the form of a QR code. Without this consent the user can install the app but cannot use the app to scan the DCC, in the form of a QR code.
